  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41746].
  {panel}

Activating the *Attach Screenshot* function in JIRA on IE 10 shows a popup with a warning that the function cannot be activated due to expired SSL Certificate.

!popup_2_ie10.png|thumbnail!

!popup_3_ie10.png|thumbnail!

!popup_4_ie10_certificate.png|thumbnail!

While more tech savvy users will still be able to activate the function by accepting the certificate regardless the warning; less tech savvy user will see this as error or a vulnerability based on the warning.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot is returning SSL Security Certificate Expired in Internet Explorer 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41736].
  {panel}

At the moment, the only way to associate project in the custom field context is through UI in *Custom field* > *Configure* > and refer to *Choose applicable context*

The problem happens when the instance has huge number of projects and a long list of custom fields to be associated with each project. 
- With the limited number of project visible in the context dialog box at a time, the process becomes troublesome. 
- Furthermore, The projects are listed alphabetically, which means that the users need to scroll down to find the desired project. 
- If the users wrongly click the project, the chance is that the previous selected projects can get deselected. 

These are a fews option how we can improve this:
- We can list the newly created project on the top of the list, which will make it easier for the user to refer to
- Have the option of how many projects can be visible in that context dialog box at a time
- Have the bulk operation for this
fields.summary: Improve the procedure to associate project in custom field context
JIRA Mobile does not work with iPad
Rearrange tabs in Agent View
Populate Epic Name with Summary when Bulk Edit Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41730].
  {panel}

Currently, our [Starting a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Starting+a+Sprint] documentation states:
bq. You will need to have the JIRA 'Administer Projects' permission in the project(s) whose issues are to be included in the new sprint. This means that if your board includes issues from multiple projects, you need to have the 'Administer Projects' permission in each of those projects.

This can cause confusion, as the behavior is that the user must be a project administrator of all projects included in the board - independent to which issues are being added to the sprint. Hence, I'm changing the above note to:
bq. You will need to have the JIRA 'Administer Projects' permission in the project(s) included in the board. This means that if your board includes issues from multiple projects, you need to have the 'Administer Projects' permission in each of those projects.
fields.summary: Review Changes to the 'Starting a Sprint' Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41728].
  {panel}

Problem:
Since we upgraded from JIRA 5.2 to 6.3.12 on 23.11.2014, we see that the work logged within JIRA (or Tempo in our case) is shown in the History tab of each issue. This was not the case in the older JIRA version.
We updated to JIRA 6.3.13 to get rid of the worklog emails, but 6.3.13 did not change the History tab problem.

Reason:
For us, it is important that Work Log entries  are only visible to concerned persons in the company. This typically are project leaders and accounting. All others should not see the worklog of others. It is OK and helpful to see ones own work logs.

Background:
Tempo does a good job in hiding work logs from others. It has permissions for time sheets that fit our needs. But at the JIRA level, this high appreciated level of privacy seems to get lost: Activity Streams show worklog entries, History Tabs show worklog entries. Both shall be hidden to users without permission to do so. We managed to hide Activity Streams (which was a long struggle and not all participants were lucky with the found solution).

This is also a legal issue: In Europe, personal data must be treated in a special way. This is enforced by national and european laws. As I understand it, the current behaviour of JIRA is not conform to European law, because work logs can be seen by people that are not involved with processing this data.

Expected Solution:
The worklog entries should be removed from the history tab for users that do not have the required permission for this. "Issue View" permission is not the right permission to use as well as "Edit All Worklogs". A "View All Worklogs" permission (vs. "View Own Worklogs") would be fine.
fields.summary: Time Spent entries show up in History tab

After enabling the New Project Navigation from the user profile menu, the Project 'Road Map', 'Change Log ', and 'Versions' sections are not linked by the new left panel.

Disabling the New Project Navigation enables the old Overview of the project that contains the 3 links.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41712].
  {panel}

 Currently you can change the global default timeout for all users via the web.xml located in your <InstallationFolderLocation>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/web.xml.  (see example below in quotes) to the desired time out:
"<session-config>
<session-timeout>300</session-timeout>
</session-config>. 

[Changing default timeout session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Changing+the+default+session+timeout"]

However you cannot do it per user.
fields.summary: Add the ability to modify  modify the user timeout variable per user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41705].
  {panel}

When editing a project permission scheme, its quick to grant *Users / Groups / Project Roles* access to any or all available permissions via the Add link under Operations. 

However, reversing that process isn't possible. Taking the *Browse Projects* permission as our example. As admin, I want to keep the admin group and remove everything else:

- Single User (John Doe) (Delete)
- Single User (Jane Doe) (Delete)
- Project Role (Developers) (Delete)
- Project Role (atlassian-addons-project-access) (Delete)
- Project Role (Clients) (Delete)
- Project Role (Users) (Delete)
- Group (administrators) (Delete)

Retaining Group (administrators), I would need to click the Delete link 6 times. I would then proceed to the next project permission and do the same, which could equate to being a non trivial administrative task. 

Ideally we could streamline deleting project permissions by providing admins with the ability to bulk delete.
fields.summary: Bulk Delete Project Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41703].
  {panel}

Hi

I have filled in the Support request [JSP-216643|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JSP/issue/JSP-216643] and looks like found some solution that can improve the multi select lists in Jira.

I have a situation when I need to edit the different settings in Jira and especially in Custom Fields settings configuration I am facing problem that the project list has very tiny visible area and does not have resizing functionality.

I would like to offer 2 changes:

# Add the "resize: vertical" to the multi select objects style
# At least show the 5-10% of the projects list

I have a situation that the list is showing only 5 lines when I have 800 projects in the Jira instance so it is about 0.625% which is quite not UI friendly at all.

Regards,
Areg
fields.summary: Project list length in Custom Field context configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41701].
  {panel}

It would be great if the JIRA filter/query capability (workflows) also supported queries against the various sub-fields presented in the 'Source' sub tab.  Here is an explicit use case (Written as an agile story):

As a member of the software team using JIRA, I would like to filter (create a JIRA filter) against both custom labels and a git branch so to be able to see which JIRAs are fixed or not fixed against which git branch so that the necessary merge work be scheduled.

More explicitly, here is a filter that we currently use:

labels = SeamlessUpgrade AND resolution = fixed AND fixVersion = RT-7 ORDER BY created DESC

We need to be able to add to the above clause something like " AND gitBranch = master" so to sub select the above JIRAs for those that are only fixed on the git master branch.

Thanks much.
fields.summary: JIRA queries should support queries against the 'Source' sub-tab fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41693].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms 
The post function "Copy Value From Field to Field Function" shows as "Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition." in the create transition.
While it might be show as the conditions in the transition like "Only users with Assignable User permission can execute this transition." in another transition if the custom field used in the copy value post functions is deleted.

Error message shows that custom field cannot be found when try to create issue. 
When you try to search the custom field id in jira workflow database, it can be found in the descriptor.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create an customer field *Client* and add it to the respective project screen and field scheme.
# Go to create transition of the workflow.
# Add post function Copy value from field *Client* to *Assignee*.(At this stage the post function should render correctly.)
# Delete custom field *Client*.
# Go to edit the same workflow transition again, you will see that the post function show as *"Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition."* instead.

Indexing does not solve the problem.
fields.summary: Post function "Copy Value From Field to Field Function" show as a conditions or validators instead when the custom field used is deleted.

I would like the ability to edit a weblink

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41682].
  {panel}

http://<host>:2990/jira/rest/api/latest/issue/<issue id>/transitions?expand=transitions.fields

Always returns "fields":{} in the returned output (no fields).

De workflow in JIRA has been adapted to include some required field validators for certain issue transitions.
When the corresponding transition is performed in JIRA it shows/proves that the validators work (are active).

However, they are never returned in the above mentioned JIRA REST request?
fields.summary: JIRA REST API to retrieve issue transition details does not return required fields for transition.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41681].
  {panel}

While importing a project from a JIRA backup the import fails with the following error.
{noformat}
The import was aborted because there were too many errors. Some errors are listed below. For full details about the errors please see your logs. Please note that some elements have been created. You may want to consult your logs to see what caused the errors, delete the project, and perform the import again.
{noformat}

A few of the following errors can be found in the JIRA logs
{noformat}
2015-01-17 15:01:50,542 ProjectImport: CreateIssueRelatedData-10 ERROR admin 901x156x1 4bmvmr 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportPersister] DataAccessException occured while trying to create Entity type 'EntityProperty' . {id=10031, entityName=IssueProperty, entityId=10115, propertyKey=request.channel.type, value="Portal", created=2015-01-08 18:51:44.178, updated=2015-01-08 18:51:44.178}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:EntityProperty][id,10031][created,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][updated,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][entityId,10115][value,"Portal"][propertyKey,request.channel.type][entityName,IssueProperty] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.entity_property (ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, CREATED, UPDATED, json_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_entity_property"
  Detail: Key (id)=(10031) already exists.))
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:397)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.createValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportPersister.createEntity(DefaultProjectImportPersister.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.EntityPropertiesPersisterHandler$1.run(EntityPropertiesPersisterHandler.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.concurrent.BoundedExecutor$1.run(BoundedExecutor.java:50)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:695)
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:EntityProperty][id,10031][created,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][updated,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][entityId,10115][value,"Portal"][propertyKey,request.channel.type][entityName,IssueProperty] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.entity_property (ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, CREATED, UPDATED, json_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_entity_property"
  Detail: Key (id)=(10031) already exists.))
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:200)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:165)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:83)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:554)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:540)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:392)
	... 7 more
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Get a JIRA backup from an instance with at least 20 Issue entities for a single project. e.g. create 10 issues with JIRA Service Desk. Each will add 3 issue entities
** You can verify that with the following SQL query
{code:SQL}select * from entity_property where entity_name = 'IssueProperty'{code}
# Import the project into another JIRA instance already containing data in the entity_property for the same IDs displayed in the query above

*Expected results*
JIRA Should import the project without any problems, using the next ID available for the entity_property table

*Actual results*
JIRA aborts the import as it tries to use the same IDs to add the respective Issue properties to the entity_properties table

*Workaround*
As a workaround you can change the EntityProperty IDs _directly in the entities.xml file of the backup_.

# Find entity IDs to change for the project. Run this at source JIRA Insert your project key into this query: {code:sql}
SELECT EP.id
FROM entity_property EP, jiraissue I, project P
WHERE EP.entity_name = 'IssueProperty' AND I.id = EP.entity_id
  AND P.id = I.project AND P.pkey = 'YOUR_PROJECT_KEY'
ORDER BY EP.id;
{code}
# Determine the current MAX(id), run this at target JIRA: {code:sql}
SELECT MAX(id) FROM entity_property
{code}
# Modify the XML backup file, replacing the entity_property IDs with sequential numbers higher than MAX(id) from the entity_property table.
#* Make sure you only modify XML nodes that begin with "<EntityProperty id=".  If the entities.xml file is large you may need to use vi or another editor that can handle really big files.
# Complete the import
# Shut down the target instance
# Reset the sequence_value_item table for EntityProperty types, run this at target JIRA: {code:sql}
UPDATE sequence_value_item SET seq_id = (SELECT MAX(id)+100 FROM entity_property) WHERE seq_name = 'EntityProperty';
{code}
# Restart the target instance

See KB for more detailed steps and simplified option to modify the XML backup file: [Project Import fails due to too many errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+fails+due+to+too+many+errors]
fields.summary: Project import aborted due to too many errors
Provide display customizations of numeric data types in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41679].
  {panel}

Currently when we import an issue via CSV we can specify the Issue Key to be used.
After the Issues were imported the next issues created manually will follow the key numbers added by the CSV file.
For example:
A user would creates KEY-1 through JIRA, then someone imports KEY-10000 via CSV. The next issue created via JIRA will be KEY-10001.

Before [JIRA 6.2.6|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29762] the next issue created would be KEY-3 in the example above.

It would be great if we can add an option to the CSV import to allow users to choose the desired behaviour since both of these can be useful depending on the user's setup.
fields.summary: Add option to choose Issue key behaviour after CSV issue import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41676].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA doesn't provide any feedback through the gui whenever the attachment directory is not writable by the service user. This does lead to lost attachments. 

h4. Steps to reproduce

- Set the {{attachments}} directory to not be writeable. 
- Attach a file

You'll notice the gui will let you complete attaching the files, and they'll show up as attachments in JIRA, however, they will not actually be in the attachments directory. 

h4. Expected Result
- The gui should prompt the user that the attachments folder is not writable, and they should contact an admin.
fields.summary: Better Error Handling for Attachment Directory Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41664].
  {panel}

*Issue*
If the SSL certificate of a system that JIRA connects with such as LDAP or crowd changes such that the certificate is issued to different DNS name or IP address or the issuer of the certificate is different then the following exception can occur, even though certificate is valid: "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: server certificate change is restricted during renegotiation".

*Cause*
The fix for CVE-2014-6457, "Triple Handshake attack against TLS/SSL connections (JSSE, 8037066)", prevents peer certificates changing during renegotiation. However, if endpoint identification (see SSLParameters.getEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm) is enabled for a connection or the potentially changed certificate is for the same 'identity' as the last certificate seen then the connection is permitted. If the identity of the certificate has changed then a "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: server certificate change is restricted during renegotiation" exception is raised.

Note: two identities are considered equal in this case if:
a) There is a subject alternative name specified in both certificates which is an IP address and the IP address in both certificates is the same.
b) There is a subject alternative name specified in both certificates which is a DNS name and the DNS name in both certificates is the same.
c) The subject and issuer fields are present in both certificates and contain identical subject and issuer values.

*Possible solution*
If you encounter a "javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: server certificate change is restricted during renegotiation" error try restarting JIRA. If the issue persists open a support issue.

*Workarounds*
* It is possible to disable the unsafe server certificate protection by applying the following JVM argument:
{code}
-Djdk.tls.allowUnsafeServerCertChange=true 
{code}
fields.summary: Support secure session resumption when changes are made to SSL certificate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41662].
  {panel}

Currently on the bulk edit screen, the fields appear to be ordered with the following logic:

(Available) System Fields, in their specific order, determined by Atlassian.
(Available) Custom Fields, in alphabetical order by name.

The problem is because this ordering is not really used anywhere else, and the possibility for fields to simply not appear (and be moved down to the bottom under a folded away section) the location for an expected field can move a lot.

If someone is regularly doing bulk operations, and the field can appear first, or 15th or not at all in the list, it makes it very difficult to find each time - even worse if you need to find multiple fields to update. This leads to admins getting questions about fields disappearing, when they haven't.

Would it be possible to re-organise this screen in a way that shows more logic to the end users, or possibly allow custom ordering of the fields?
fields.summary: Better ordering of fields on the Bulk Edit Screen
JIRA REST interface for disabling an option from drop-down custom field

At the moment a user has to either:

* Switch to Desktop version and then switch application (and the browser will remember you are in Desktop version the next time you are back in JIRA)
fields.summary: On Mobile View, provide a way to switch between applications

Audit log for change to Status configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41653].
  {panel}

A missing feature of JIRA is the ability to document the usage of schema entities for the EndUser (screens and fields, workflows and so on).
In would be nice to a have a very special confluence space, namely «Jira Help», where Jira admins can document all the elements above mentioned. 
The Space would be populated automatically by all the «documentable» entities of the Jira projects. At the same time, every element of the JIRA that has been provided with an help, would be enabled to show the documentation.
It would be so possible to:
- Document screens
- Document fields (possibily on screens)
- Document states (possibly on workflows)
- Document workflows
- Document validations on workflows
and so on… with an integrated help on line in Jira
fields.summary: «Jira Help» Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41651].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding custom fields to JIRA issue screens, it is not possible to dictate where these fields show up. Currently custom fields always show up in the left hand column of the 'Details' section of the issue.

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.305.0
Server - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field or utilize an existing one
# Edit any screen within a project
# Add this custom field to the screen
# Create a new ticket
# Ensure that you have input data into this custom field
# View the new ticket

h3. Expected Results
When editing the screen, a user should have the ability to specify which column the field will be displayed in just like he/she can place fields on separate tabs

h3. Actual Results
There is actually no option to specify field location within the screen edit page
 
h3. Notes
In addition to this, it would helpful if custom sections could be created for JIRA tickets as well
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I would like the ability to change the location of where a custom field is displayed in an issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41648].
  {panel}

Today when reseting the password, we get the following message after type the username:

!reset.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if we can have a more generic message in this screen, not leading the customer to think he did everything correct.

The reason why I'm asking this is because the same message appears if you type an inexistent username. Maybe a message like "If a valid username was informed, you should receive a email (...) If the email does not arrive, please contact your JIRA administrators.".
fields.summary: Generic message when reseting password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41632].
  {panel}

h4. Steps
# Open fresh IE in order to circumvent potential "do not show this message" from the past.
# Click an issue collector button.
# Ignore Javascript errors (e.g. via "do not show this message again").
# Fill the form, including an attachment.
# Submit the form.

h4. Expectation
Step #3 should not be necessary. A confirmation with link to the created issue should be seen.

h4. Reality
After step #2 Javascript errors occur multiple times, stating that {{'JIRA' is undefined}} - [^Screen Shot 2015-01-14 at 17.52.13.png], hence step #3.
When the form is submitted, there is a tiny {{textarea}} with JSON inside it - [^Screen Shot 2015-01-14 at 18.08.16.png]. The issue is created, but *the attachment is not there*.
fields.summary: Issue collector errors on IE9
Support database connection using LDAP string

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41630].
  {panel}

Current behavior: 
When you make a comment on an issue in Jira, the timestamp on that comment will initially display as "in one minute".  This doesn't make any sense.

Expected behavior: 
When you make a comment on an issue, the timestamp should either show as "one minute ago", or simply display the date and time that the comment was entered.
fields.summary: Comment log shows "in one minute" rather than "one minute ago"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41629].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
[STRM-2272|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2272] might cause a timeout with a message saying "The activity source for 'JIRA' was slow to respond and isn't included." and "No activity was found" where the data should be when trying to view Activity Stream gadgets. This issue tracks the upgrade of JIRA to use a more recent version of Activity Streams (5.4.13) in which the issue was fixed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This issue can be replicated in environments where issues have very long histories and many records are returned.

h3. Expected Results
The Activity Stream is expected to show the stream of activities. 

h3. Actual Results
The Activity Stream shows an error reporting no activities, or the slow to respond message.

h3. Notes
For more information, please see: [STRM-2272|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2272] and [JIRA Activity Stream returns One or more activity sources were slow to respond and are not included|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Activity+Stream+returns+One+or+more+activity+sources+were+slow+to+respond+and+are+not+included].
fields.summary: Activity Stream can timeout for issues with very long histories
Provide the ability to sent notifications based on schedules
Update Running JIRA as a Service documentation
Workflow that do have dialogs do not have ellipses on their buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Current Behaviour
When accessing JIRA on a Mobile Device, a header is visible suggesting to *Switch to Mobile View*. 

h3. Feature Request
When accessing JIRA on a Mobile Device, the header suggesting to *Switch to Mobile View* should be disabled because it is consuming space.
fields.summary: Disable "Switch to Mobile View" header on mobile browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41623].
  {panel}

Instead of using the getProjectObject() used the getProjectId() to reduce the time taken for indexing.

Trace for reference:
{code}
"IssueIndexer:thread-9" #1642 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00002b47d1ad6000 nid=0xc98 runnable [0x00002b490ea71000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$AccessQueue.contains(LocalCache.java:3847)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.drainRecencyQueue(LocalCache.java:2624)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.expireEntries(LocalCache.java:2648)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.runLockedCleanup(LocalCache.java:3484)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.cleanUp(LocalCache.java:3476)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.postReadCleanup(LocalCache.java:3452)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2238)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3970)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:3974)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4834)
        at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCachedReference.get(DelegatingCachedReference.java:56)
        at com.atlassian.jira.project.CachingProjectManager.getProjectObj(CachingProjectManager.java:101)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl.getProjectObject(IssueImpl.java:354)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.getRelevantConfigSchemeId(CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.java:176)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.isRelevantForIssueContext(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:287)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.isRelevantForIssueContext(CustomFieldImpl.java:674)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.indexers.impl.AbstractCustomFieldIndexer.isRelevantForIssue(AbstractCustomFieldIndexer.java:62)
{code}
fields.summary: Reduce indexing time by explicitly requesting for project ID instead of project's objects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41619].
  {panel}

I'm the maintainer of the Sauce Connector plugin for Jira (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/manage/plugins/net.customware.plugins.connector.saucelabs.saucelabs-connector-plugin)

The plugin is currently available to Jira OnDemand users and we've just released a new version which fixes an error that is generated when users attempt to use the plugin.

The error that is thrown is a NoSuchMethodError, and the error is related to the Customware Atlassian Adapter plugin.  As far as I can tell, version 1.4.26 of the Customware adapter plugin is now being used by Jira OnDemand, and this version includes a change to the RemoteUpdateRecord class which is incompatible with the version of the Sauce Connector plugin,

Specifically, the net.customware.plugins.connector.core.remote.bean.RemoteUpdateRecord class in previously had a no-arg constructor, but now has a constructor with arguments.

We've released version 1.6 of the Sauce Connector plugin (available from https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/artifact/96a2dfde-d2cd-4f6d-8c28-c2db603c3142/saucelabs-connector-plugin-1.6.jar) - would you be able to make this version of the plugin available to Jira OnDemand users?
fields.summary: Allow version 1.6 of Sauce Connector plugin to be available to Jira OnDemand users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41617].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When configuring Global Filters for Activity Streams, the username textbox is a free text field. Adding more than one user separated by commas causes a SQL Exception in the logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an Activity Stream to a Dashboard
# Add a Global filter with the configuration below:
#* {{Username}} {{is/is not}} \[*user1, user2*\]

Obs: The usernames may be valid or invalid ones and the exception still happens.

h3. Expected Results
No exception in the logs.

h3. Actual Results
The following exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
*MySQL:*
{noformat}
2015-01-14 15:58:09,739 StreamsCompletionService::thread-21 ERROR admin 958x1381x1 158u8c6 10.60.4.135 /plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Exception building feed
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:MySQL
	- version:5.6.21-log
	- minor version:6
	- major version:5
Driver:
	- name:MySQL Connector Java
	- version:mysql-connector-java-5.1.26 ( Revision: ${bzr.revision-id} )

java.sql.SQLException: Parameter index out of range (51 > number of parameters, which is 50).
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.find(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.DelegatingActiveObjects.find(DelegatingActiveObjects.java:93)  <+2>
{noformat}

*PostgreSQL*
{noformat}
2015-10-21 15:59:30,806 StreamsCompletionService::thread-1993 ERROR admin 959x74842x1 17b6pej 192.168.10.137 /plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Exception building feed
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
        - name:PostgreSQL
        - version:9.4.0
        - minor version:4
        - major version:9
Driver:
        - name:PostgreSQL Native Driver
        - version:PostgreSQL 9.0 JDBC4 (build 801)
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: The column index is out of range: 65, number of columns: 64.
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.find(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:185)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects.find(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:335)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
{noformat}

*PostgreSQL (JIRA 7)*
{noformat}
2015-10-21 16:00:59,187 StreamsCompletionService::thread-98 ERROR admin 960x4399x1 az6hzx 192.168.10.174 /plugins/servlet/streams [c.a.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Exception building feed
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:PostgreSQL
	- version:9.4.0
	- minor version:4
	- major version:9
Driver:
	- name:PostgreSQL Native Driver
	- version:PostgreSQL 9.0 JDBC4 (build 801)
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: The column index is out of range: 14, number of columns: 13.
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.find(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects.find(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:291)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Although the exception is written to the logs, the Activity Stream applies the global filter correctly.

h3.Workaround
(!) *Important*: This workaround might prevent troubleshooting real problems with the Activity Stream, since *any errors will be suppressed*.

[Set the logging level|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+set+logging+level+for+a+package+in+JIRA] for the package below to {{OFF}}:
* {{atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider}}
fields.summary: SQL Exception on Activity Stream when Using Global Filters for Multiple Usernames
Align Custom Field Right

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41605].
  {panel}

Currently, when writing comments you'd need to stop writing it, attach the file or screenshot, and then add the screenshot to the comment field.

If the comment is inside a transition, you'd need to also have the 'Attachments' field in the same screen, and when previewing the comment JIRA will show a red warning saying that there isn't such attachment.

It would be very convenient if it was possibly to attach a screenshot directly into the text (using crtl/cmd+V), similarly to the capability in the Confluence editor.

This would be specially helpful as the [Wiki Editor for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-wiki-editor] will be bundled in the future.

Request to have a default field for phone number of user profile which can be viewed at issues page. ( Different from property )



- phone number per user in in the issue navigator that points to the reporters phone number.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41594].
  {panel}

After renaming a project and project key on SDOG I could no longer access the project.

*Workaround*
* Create a new dummy project with the same key as the *newly renamed pkey*
* In the UI, the system may seem like it's not responding
* In the logs, we will see an error indicating duplicate project keys
* At this point, simply cancel the creation request 
* After which I could access the renamed project as expected.

Details:
Old key was 'CRAP', new key is 'REALM'.
REALM showed up in available project list, but trying to open the project gave me the "Project not found" page.
I used to be able to see and administrate the project before the change.
Background re-index did not help.
fields.summary: Project may become unavailable after changing key and/or name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41592].
  {panel}

Kids! They won't stay off my lawn, and now they want *emoji*, for crying out loud!

http://www.emoji-cheat-sheet.com/

As one user put it, "Emoji are very helpful for communicating nuance and detail, in ways that English just doesn't support. We rely heavily on emoji in our Github communication; JIRA feels...hollow without it."

The use case for us is that we'd like consistent user experience across all the products our developers use. We use Github Enterprise, so users are sad and disappointed when their cleverness can't be equally shared in JIRA.
fields.summary: Users Want Emoji!

Hi my Jira sprint board is stuck in an refresh loop which seems to only effect my account and not other members of my team. This seems affect all my sprint boards but here is one particular one as an example: 

https://essencedigital.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=19&selectedIssue=OTD-1402&quickFilter=57

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41578].
  {panel}

h5.symptoms
When users try to access JIRA Agile boards or Service Desk, pages reload infinitely. It's also the case for some Connect add-ons.

h5.cause
Due to a temporary bug we just encountered, JIRA is parsing usernames incorrectly when *there's a space in the username*. That's why Connect add-ons using username as a parameter are affected too. A bug fix in in progress.

h5. WORKAROUND
The bug fix is in progress. If access is urgent for your team you can work around the issue by renaming the user to remove all spaces from their username. Only users with _site-admins_ access can rename users.

(i) UPDATE 12/1/15 13:00hrs GMT+0: We are currently still working on a fix at the back end. The fix will be released to all affected Cloud instances soonest possible. Please *watch* this issue to get latest information on the fix.
(i) UPDATE 12/1/15 13:30hrs GMT+0: This issue is confirmed to affect also JIRA Server 6.3.13 and will be fixed in 6.3.14
(i) UPDATE 12/1/15 13:50hrs GMT+0: We are currently testing a fix and will start deployment shortly if successful.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile and Service Desk pages constantly refresh for users with space in a username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41576].
  {panel}

*Situation*: 
- universal workflow for all Scrum projects
- need to notify developer chat room on HipChat whenever there's a transition on a task

*Problem*: with universal workflow that is used across different projects, it is not possible to define project-specific HipChat room for a project. On the other hand, universal HipChat room is of no use since on many projects and all developers in a single room, it devalues.

*Possible solution*: have an environment variable with chat room name that is picked from the project settings, not the Workflow that may be generic and used across different projects.
fields.summary: Decouple HipChat notifications from Workflow
License "Additonal Details" Not Useful for Users of JIRA OD
Rename 'Raised in Versions' field selection to 'Affects Version/s' in Two Dimensional Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41572].
  {panel}

Our company uses multiple Atlassian products, like Jira, Confluence, Bamboo and Crucible. For source code control we are using PlasticSCM since it's the best state of the art tool for that. We have experiences with git, subversion, cvs and mercuical but all of them are not a patch on PlasticSCM. Unfortunately non of the Atlassian products supports PlasticSCM directly.

Currently we are using the PlasticSCM plugins provides by Codice. But most of the time there are not as nice integrated as the repositories which are directly supported by Atlassian. 

We think it is necessary for Atlassian to support PlasticSCM natively, since it's the best SCM system on the market, at least in our opinion. The native support would add value to all Atlassian products.

Especially Fisheye would benefit of a PlasticSCM support, since there isn't a plugin available yet. If you would integrate PlasticSCM support to Fisheye, we would immediatly buy a License for our Company. And I am sure others will do the same!
fields.summary: Adding Plastic SCM repository support
Redirect user to Project Administration screen after Project creation
